youngAndEnthusiasticFullStackWebDevelope: Young and enthusiastic full-stack web developer
aboutMeText:
I have been working within the area of web development for over 3 years. I can solve non-trivial problems, plan work, design and program software.

My main skills are:

  • Front-end: JavaScript, Vue.js, React, Angular,
  • Back-end: Express, TypeScript, TypeORM, SQL,
  • Automated testing: Cypress, Jest,
  • Design: UI, REST API, database,
  • Blockchain: Solidity, Remix, Web3,
  • Operating systems: Windows, Linux,
  • Git versioning system.
educationText: Successfully completed bachelor degree on Faculty of Information Technology at Brno University of Technology
SelfEmployedDescription:
I had a longer self-improvement vacation during which I devoted myself to personal development:

  • I studied the development of smart contracts,
  • I tried Angular,
  • I worked as a tutor of informatics, mathematics and physics online,
  • I wrote parser bot for a Telegram in Python,
  • I traded with cryptocurrencies,
  • I developed my soft skills,
  • and, last but not least, I devoted myself to physical and mental regeneration.
TFWorkDescription:
The scope of my work was design and implementation of UI, REST API and tests in JavaScript and TypeScript.

Projects:

  • frontend of application for managing software product settings, making payments and communicating with support,
  • frontend and backend of the internal company management system,
  • frontend and backend of application for transport company (tickets and goods sale, processing of applications for chip cards, etc.).

I also passed an exam from the book “Clean Code”, tried to create CSS animations and develop applications for Android with Flutter.
IWWorkDescription: Work for startup. Development of a CRM system for obtaining customer requirements for a web in PHP 7 language (Nette framework), SQL and JavaScript (jQuery framework). The CRM system was also a practical part of my bachelor's thesis.
hobbyText: Also, I like to dance lindy hop 💃🏼
imLookingForwardToYourReply: I look forward to your reply 🙂
